positive.review: I've never finished this game, I get bored after getting a few GC1 cultivators and just stop playing. But it seems like it's probably a good game.

Very complicated game

Amazing to learn and play tho. I am still obsessed and trying to learn slowly things I do not yet understand...

Playing 100h is not even enough to see tip of the iceberg

You either are sweating and reading tens of guides and some obscure knowledge or mess up everything like Me and try to learn by Yourself (after seeing some tutorial series on YT what took 15h XD)

Thing is. Eventually u will have to read those boring Excel files, but I prefer to do It after I test all things I want Myself and only to min-max everything when I have solid decent game knowledge :)

I think I'll need to play another few thousand hours to say I truly get game mechanics & cleared all difficulties etc. (y)
It's sometimes hard to understand but other than that it's a good game.

The game is great but lacks explanation for many mechanics. With some Polish it would easily be a 9/10. Currently its a Strong 7.5/10. Would easily recomnd on a sale or if you like cultivation and rimworld like games, buy it now.

If you got the autism to handle it, its one hell of a fun time sinker.
just keep wikipedia handy and an open mind with the iffy translations.
oh and leave your big beasty neighbor alone until your protagonist reaches golden core.
Its a interesting mix of Rim World to a degree and Chinese Cultivation.
雪雁無需沐浴就能潔白如雪。你也是一樣，只要做自己就好。
The only complaint is the missing or incomplete translations, and mods not being in english.
rage quit an hour into the game because i lost the mandate of heaven :(
games confusin, would buy again

I... I see Mt. Tai

First run: I ordered my sect leader to ingest a pill that was supposed to increase her max Qi… and she died. 10/10, will try again. 9 hours gone.

Second run, another 38 hours later: I told my sect leader to learn every skill that increases max Qi. I did — and now he’s a eunuch. Took me a few in-game days to realize some of those skills were for women only. Didn’t save manually, so yeah… time for another run.

Third run, 54 hours in: It seemed like I was finally getting the hang of the game. Buying things wasn’t a problem anymore—I had two Golden Core cultivators and one physical cultivator. Then out of nowhere, an evil sect physical cultivators came to my sect. They killed my two Golden Core cultivators, and although my physical cultivator survived, the enemy escaped with some of my scrolls and books. A few minutes later, three demon beasts showed up, slaughtered all my outer disciples, destroyed my buildings, and then ran off—leaving my lone physical cultivator standing in the ruins.

Fourth run, 64 hours in: I sent my only cultivator on an adventure, and suddenly two animals broke through in their cultivation in my map and wiped out all my outer disciples. I don’t even know what to do anymore.

Basically Rimworld with a cultivation mythology overhaul.  I didnt care much for Rimworld but the mythos was enough to engage me.  

Pros: 
Its a game that can be both active and passive, you can sit up and be fully engaged microing everything, or you can play more passively, set things up and leave it running in the background while you do other things, just looking over when a notification pops up
It is honestly incredibly indepth on how far it goes down the cultivation development.

Cons: 
All that indepth is pretty poorly explained.  I know is pretty much a meme that strategy games have sucky tutorials, but they dont do a good job of explaining even what they do cover, and some of them dont even work in the english language it gets stuck.  Had to switch to Chinese use one of those translate camera apps, which is kinda ridiculous.  Again, its a problem with the genre as a whole, but having to go through a fan made 100 page guide on a topic the game doesnt even touch is ridiculous (plants awakening intelligence in this specific case)
Also, the game is missing a couple convience mechanics Rimworld has.  You can prolly find mods to add them in, but I nvr saw them. Setting a 'maintain order' on keeping food in stock, you couldnt tell them "make 100 if meals is less than 100" for example
I've never finished this game, I get bored after getting a few GC1 cultivators and just stop playing. But it seems like it's probably a good game.

Recommended, because this game delivers what it promises: A RimWorld-like base game, overlaid with all the classic xianxia tropes: cultivation, warring sects, inner and outer disciples, manuals describing powerful techniques, and popular Daoist-inspired mysticism.

The RimWorld-like portions of the game are a bit basic. The work priority system is limited to "on" and "off", and you can't say "make timber from logs whenever I have less than 30 timber". But unlike some RimWorld knockoffs, you do need to pay attention to individual disciples, including the outer disciples who actually do the work. As a RimWorld-like game, it's a decent B-tier.

Inner disciples require significant individualized attention, because they're your major weapons, your adventurers, and your magic crafters. The game mechanics support the literary tropes here: the main job of your inner disciples is to become ever more powerful.

But xianxia is all about gaining power through esoteric knowledge. And this game really leans into "esoteric knowledge" mechanically: You will need to learn Daoist elementalist interactions. You will need to care about the feng shui of your bedrooms. You will be constantly searching for secret manuals and rare natural treasures. You will care about the cultivation potential of your recruits. You will search for advanced cultivation paths (and each path works differently). The game is full of subsystems and hidden knowledge.

There are also some things to be aware of. Several of the tutorials have been broken for years. The English-language documentation and wikis only scratch the surface. There are some occasional bugs in actual game play.

But overall, this is a positive review, because if you want a B-tier RimWorld base with xianxia tropes, and if you want to search for esoteric knowledge in order to gain ridiculous power, the game delivers. It's a very solid match between mechanics and tropes.

Love this game.  Its one of 3 games that Ive never uninstalled since I bought it.  Every time I play I learn something new or discover something different or crazy, and reading the little chat things on every item is super entertaining.  10/10 and I cant say that for many  games, especially modern ones.  You can tell this was a pure labor of love.  <3  Ty devs, stoked for ACS2 as well!

Initially had a struggle with this game because it had so many complex and intricate features compared to Rimworld but I found out how to actually play the game and I am hooked. All you gotta do is treat your outer disciples as if they are sub-human tools to gain extra cultivation for your inner disciples. Yaoguai cultivation about to face tribulation and you're not ready? just use yin god possession on a human and suddenly you don't have to die anymore! 10/10 I'm now addicted to Chinese Cultivaiton

This game, tells you nothing helpful. Doesn't help you in anyway. Will actively try to sabotage you, it will even lie to you. It's full of hidden mechanics. Everything the game does to you, you can do right back to it. True to cultivation, this simulation is accurate in it's ability to be petty and unforgiving. The ultimate kick in the teeth simulator and if you're like me you will love every minute of it. 

Some of the fun things you can do is, weaponize any and everything including your phallus or pile of dog poo to the point where it would slay an ancient dragon god ancestor. Live through the injury having your head blown off, only to possess the body of your best friend's wife to continue living. Suffer every injury known to man.  Learn the truth that no one likes you and they never will like you. Learn that, everyone is awful and so you should just be awful right back. Sit on your butt, take every drug you can find and mediate for years to attain the power to turn your own farts into a nuclear weapon. Okay I lied on the last part...not really, the lie is a lie. 

Have fun now
Eat, sleep, cultivate, repeat.

If you got the autism to handle it, its one hell of a fun time sinker.
just keep wikipedia handy and an open mind with the iffy translations.
oh and leave your big beasty neighbor alone until your protagonist reaches golden core.

i like rimworld and i like this game

the setup and story stuff is solid.
rimworld fan, find it has better features for utility, but this has so much more interesting story features..

Okay so I just checked my Steam Review page to see how many reviews I've written, zero...a big fat ZERO! I've got 102 games and had Steam since November 2005, with 1000's of hours of game time across the board. Why have I never written a review? Not sure as there's a number of games I absolutely adore. Medieval Total War 2 - Divide and Conquer especially, Mount & Blade Warband, Kenshi, LOTRO etc etc. 

Why have I decided to review Amazing Cultivation Simulator as my first, with only 21.7 hours playtime? Because IT'S AMAZING, it's fits EVERYTHING that I want in a game and the depth it's phenomenal. I haven't even touched the sides yet. For me, currently, it's perfect!

I stumbled open this game earlier in the week when I was searching for a colony sim I could actually enjoy and get my head around, but what I found was something MUCH MORE than a colony sim. It's perfect, just perfect. And I was told it's insanely complicated. I haven't felt that at all, sure there's so much depth and it will only get deeper and more involved as I progress but it's currently at a slow and manageable pace which is what I love.

I couldn't get my head around Dwarf Fortress, or even Rimworld, after the tutorial I no longer want to play, and I've tried it a number of times. I've wanted to like them but I can't, for some unknown reason. After finding out about ACS on a Colony Sim Reddit post I decided to investigate, and I bought the game. I tried working my way through the MANY tutorials but stopped after a while...there's LOADS explaining many different aspects of ACS interface and systems. There was also an issue a couple of times with translation in English where the tutorial won't progress unless you switch to Chinese and restart, which I did, twice or thrice. THERE IS NO ISSUE IN THE MAIN GAME, only a few short tutorials, but can be over come by using a Translate camera app on your phone and then switching back to English for the next tutorial.

Over the last week I tried playing another 5 or so other games, colony sims too, including Rimworld, but couldn't get into any of them. Lord's and Villains came closest, and Ascent to Ashes even closer, but this is an Early Access game with a number of bugs and not for me at the moment, in the future for sure.

So switching back and forth and ignoring ACS, not starting a proper game, last night I decided to finally just go ahead and start a proper game without completely all the many tutorials (they are no compulsory obviously). Going in blind they say, no guides, no Wiki's. So I start the game...maybe 8pm last night...I end up logging off at 4:08am - my last save. I couldn't put it down. And yes, this has happened in other games sure, but I've come back on today, and tonight, and only stopped to write this as I've just cooked some food.

I finally created a Sect, my Sect Leader was disappointed in her mood as she had so much shame around being labelled a 'Shit Eater'...yes I got her to eat 'Male Turtle Faeces' not sure why but I did okay. A member of another Sect visited me and sat on the spare cushion in my self made and named 'Cultivation Room'. The temperature exceeded 60 degrees C, not realising he was passed out and dying on the floor next to my Sect Leader, who was still cultivating her Fire Law, hence the heat needed in the room. As he was dying of heatstroke I had two options, interrogate to learn his secrets (apparently that would speed up his death though) or 'Search', I decided to get one of my disciples to search his drying body, and found my first artefact! Lucky me, unlucky for him. He died, and his corresponding Sect became understandably angry with my Sect for letting him die in my care, so I buried him - in a tomb! This was in case they wished to visit him, wanted to pay him at least some respect for kindly gifting me my first artefact.

I got a dog, a puppy, at first I really thought I'd made the wrong decision as he kept biting and wounding my disciples! Then popping in their beds, urinating in the crops, eat all the cooked food and destroying my buildings! But I've trained him, now he can chop trees just by his magic breath! And mine ore the same way too! He can carry things and kill things and break things. But he learns, and I'm sure he will grow too, although I hope not much as I kinda like him at his current "puppy" size!

I have not even broken the ice on this game, only have 5 disciples, one died randomly, think he was cooking something and somehow died very early on.  I'm still learning and there's a lot of options still not open to me. But the detail, the little interactions between characters, the Feng Shui, the different minerals and elements and spells and laws etc etc etc. I'm glad I can take this game slow, and I feel it is at my own pace currently. I only have one achievement out of the 401 available. That's for playing over a certain amount of time in a row! The others are apparently only unlocked on the harder difficulty level, which is how it's meant to be played apparently. I await that day! For now I'm still learning, and I'M LOVING IT! 

Will update if I feel the need, if I don't, and my hours have increased, then just knows this - THIS MAY WELL JUST BE MY PERFECT GAME! :D :D Welcome to the World of Cultivation! 

Hare Krishna x
I spent 2 weeks doing nothing but reading and still don't know what I'm doing
Super interesting and alot more to explore

Recommended, because this game delivers what it promises: A RimWorld-like base game, overlaid with all the classic xianxia tropes: cultivation, warring sects, inner and outer disciples, manuals describing powerful techniques, and popular Daoist-inspired mysticism.

The RimWorld-like portions of the game are a bit basic. The work priority system is limited to "on" and "off", and you can't say "make timber from logs whenever I have less than 30 timber". But unlike some RimWorld knockoffs, you do need to pay attention to individual disciples, including the outer disciples who actually do the work. As a RimWorld-like game, it's a decent B-tier.

But xianxia is all about gaining power through esoteric knowledge. And this game really leans into "esoteric knowledge" mechanically: You will need to learn Daoist elementalist interactions. But overall, this is a positive review, because if you want a B-tier RimWorld base with xianxia tropes, and if you want to search for esoteric knowledge in order to gain ridiculous power, the game delivers. It's a very solid match between mechanics and tropes.

Okay so I just checked my Steam Review page to see how many reviews I've written, zero...a big fat ZERO! I've got 102 games and had Steam since November 2005, with 1000's of hours of game time across the board. Why have I never written a review? Not sure as there's a number of games I absolutely adore. Medieval Total War 2 - Divide and Conquer especially, Mount & Blade Warband, Kenshi, LOTRO etc etc. 

Why have I decided to review Amazing Cultivation Simulator as my first, with only 21.7 hours playtime? Because IT'S AMAZING, it's fits EVERYTHING that I want in a game and the depth it's phenomenal. I haven't even touched the sides yet. For me, currently, it's perfect!

I stumbled open this game earlier in the week when I was searching for a colony sim I could actually enjoy and get my head around, but what I found was something MUCH MORE than a colony sim. It's perfect, just perfect. And I was told it's insanely complicated. I haven't felt that at all, sure there's so much depth and it will only get deeper and more involved as I progress but it's currently at a slow and manageable pace which is what I love.

I couldn't get my head around Dwarf Fortress, or even Rimworld, after the tutorial I no longer want to play, and I've tried it a number of times. I've wanted to like them but I can't, for some unknown reason. After finding out about ACS on a Colony Sim Reddit post I decided to investigate, and I bought the game. I tried working my way through the MANY tutorials but stopped after a while...there's LOADS explaining many different aspects of ACS interface and systems. There was also an issue a couple of times with translation in English where the tutorial won't progress unless you switch to Chinese and restart, which I did, twice or thrice. THERE IS NO ISSUE IN THE MAIN GAME, only a few short tutorials, but can be over come by using a Translate camera app on your phone and then switching back to English for the next tutorial.

Over the last week I tried playing another 5 or so other games, colony sims too, including Rimworld, but couldn't get into any of them. Lord's and Villains came closest, and Ascent to Ashes even closer, but this is an Early Access game with a number of bugs and not for me at the moment, in the future for sure.

So switching back and forth and ignoring ACS, not starting a proper game, last night I decided to finally just go ahead and start a proper game without completely all the many tutorials (they are no compulsory obviously). Going in blind they say, no guides, no Wiki's. So I start the game...maybe 8pm last night...I end up logging off at 4:08am - my last save. I couldn't put it down. And yes, this has happened in other games sure, but I've come back on today, and tonight, and only stopped to write this as I've just cooked some food.

I finally created a Sect, my Sect Leader was disappointed in her mood as she had so much shame around being labelled a 'Shit Eater'...yes I got her to eat 'Male Turtle Faeces' not sure why but I did okay. A member of another Sect visited me and sat on the spare cushion in my self made and named 'Cultivation Room'. The temperature exceeded 60 degrees C, not realising he was passed out and dying on the floor next to my Sect Leader, who was still cultivating her Fire Law, hence the heat needed in the room. As he was dying of heatstroke I had two options, interrogate to learn his secrets (apparently that would speed up his death though) or 'Search', I decided to get one of my disciples to search his drying body, and found my first artefact! Lucky me, unlucky for him. He died, and his corresponding Sect became understandably angry with my Sect for letting him die in my care, so I buried him - in a tomb! This was in case they wished to visit him, wanted to pay him at least some respect for kindly gifting me my first artefact.

I got a dog, a puppy, at first I really thought I'd made the wrong decision as he kept biting and wounding my disciples! Then popping in their beds, urinating in the crops, eat all the cooked food and destroying my buildings! But I've trained him, now he can chop trees just by his magic breath! And mine ore the same way too! He can carry things and kill things and break things. But he learns, and I'm sure he will grow too, although I hope not much as I kinda like him at his current "puppy" size!

I have not even broken the ice on this game, only have 5 disciples, one died randomly, think he was cooking something and somehow died very early on.  I'm still learning and there's a lot of options still not open to me. But the detail, the little interactions between characters, the Feng Shui, the different minerals and elements and spells and laws etc etc etc. I'm glad I can take this game slow, and I feel it is at my own pace currently. I only have one achievement out of the 401 available. That's for playing over a certain amount of time in a row! The others are apparently only unlocked on the harder difficulty level, which is how it's meant to be played apparently. I await that day! For now I'm still learning, and I'M LOVING IT! 

Will update if I feel the need, if I don't, and my hours have increased, then just knows this - THIS MAY WELL JUST BE MY PERFECT GAME! :D :D Welcome to the World of Cultivation!

　 　 │　　|　|　|
　／￣|　　 |　|　|
　| (￣ヽ＿_ヽ_)__)
　＼二つ

First run: I ordered my sect leader to ingest a pill that was supposed to increase her max Qi… and she died. 10/10, will try again. 9 hours gone.

Second run, another 38 hours later: I told my sect leader to learn every skill that increases max Qi. I did — and now he’s a eunuch. Took me a few in-game days to realize some of those skills were for women only. Didn’t save manually, so yeah… time for another run.

Third run, 54 hours in: It seemed like I was finally getting the hang of the game. Buying things wasn’t a problem anymore—I had two Golden Core cultivators and one physical cultivator. Then out of nowhere, an evil sect physical cultivators came to my sect. They killed my two Golden Core cultivators, and although my physical cultivator survived, the enemy escaped with some of my scrolls and books. A few minutes later, three demon beasts showed up, slaughtered all my outer disciples, destroyed my buildings, and then ran off—leaving my lone physical cultivator standing in the ruins.

Fourth run, 64 hours in: I sent my only cultivator on an adventure, and suddenly two animals broke through in their cultivation in my map and wiped out all my outer disciples. I don’t even know what to do anymore.

Basically Rimworld with a cultivation mythology overhaul.  I didnt care much for Rimworld but the mythos was enough to engage me.  

Pros: 
Its a game that can be both active and passive, you can sit up and be fully engaged microing everything, or you can play more passively, set things up and leave it running in the background while you do other things, just looking over when a notification pops up
It is honestly incredibly indepth on how far it goes down the cultivation development.

Cons: 
All that indepth is pretty poorly explained.  I know is pretty much a meme that strategy games have sucky tutorials, but they dont do a good job of explaining even what they do cover, and some of them dont even work in the english language it gets stuck.  Had to switch to Chinese use one of those translate camera apps, which is kinda ridiculous.  Again, its a problem with the genre as a whole, but having to go through a fan made 100 page guide on a topic the game doesnt even touch is ridiculous (plants awakening intelligence in this specific case)
Also, the game is missing a couple convience mechanics Rimworld has.  You can prolly find mods to add them in, but I nvr saw them. Setting a 'maintain order' on keeping food in stock, you couldnt tell them "make 100 if meals is less than 100" for example
I've never finished this game, I get bored after getting a few GC1 cultivators and just stop playing. But it seems like it's probably a good game.

Recommended, because this game delivers what it promises: A RimWorld-like base game, overlaid with all the classic xianxia tropes: cultivation, warring sects, inner and outer disciples, manuals describing powerful techniques, and popular Daoist-inspired mysticism.

The RimWorld-like portions of the game are a bit basic. The work priority system is limited to "on" and "off", and you can't say "make timber from logs whenever I have less than 30 timber". But unlike some RimWorld knockoffs, you do need to pay attention to individual disciples, including the outer disciples who actually do the work. As a RimWorld-like game, it's a decent B-tier.

Inner disciples require significant individualized attention, because they're your major weapons, your adventurers, and your magic crafters. The game mechanics support the literary tropes here: the main job of your inner disciples is to become ever more powerful.

But xianxia is all about gaining power through esoteric knowledge. And this game really leans into "esoteric knowledge" mechanically: You will need to learn Daoist elementalist interactions. You will need to care about the feng shui of your bedrooms. You will be constantly searching for secret manuals and rare natural treasures. You will care about the cultivation potential of your recruits. You will search for advanced cultivation paths (and each path works differently). The game is full of subsystems and hidden knowledge.

There are also some things to be aware of. Several of the tutorials have been broken for years. The English-language documentation and wikis only scratch the surface. There are some occasional bugs in actual game play.

But overall, this is a positive review, because if you want a B-tier RimWorld base with xianxia tropes, and if you want to search for esoteric knowledge in order to gain ridiculous power, the game delivers. It's a very solid match between mechanics and tropes.

I am an immigrant with many problems, I had so many troubled relationships; cheaters, liars, abusers etc. I am also suffering clinical depression This game is the most painful experience I`ve ever had. 

10/10 
Happy to suffer tribulations for my Yaoguai again. 

Release the second game already!

I enjoy playing it but I need to stop microing everything and just try to get to late game for once.

It's complicated and I had to read a lot of wiki/guides to figure things out in detail, but if you don't mind the details it's still good.

Very complicated game

Amazing to learn and play tho. I am still obsessed and trying to learn slowly things I do not yet understand...

Playing 100h is not even enough to see tip of the iceberg

You either are sweating and reading tens of guides and some obscure knowledge or mess up everything like Me and try to learn by Yourself (after seeing some tutorial series on YT what took 15h XD)

Thing is. Eventually u will have to read those boring Excel files, but I prefer to do It after I test all things I want Myself and only to min-max everything when I have solid decent game knowledge :)

I think I'll need to play another few thousand hours to say I truly get game mechanics & cleared all difficulties etc. (y)
It's sometimes hard to understand but other than that it's a good game.

The game is great but lacks explanation for many mechanics. With some Polish it would easily be a 9/10. Currently its a Strong 7.5/10. Would easily recomnd on a sale or if you like cultivation and rimworld like games, buy it now.

Love this game.  Its one of 3 games that Ive never uninstalled since I bought it.  Every time I play I learn something new or discover something different or crazy, and reading the little chat things on every item is super entertaining.  10/10 and I cant say that for many  games, especially modern ones.  You can tell this was a pure labor of love.  <3  Ty devs, stoked for ACS2 as well!

Initially had a struggle with this game because it had so many complex and intricate features compared to Rimworld but I found out how to actually play the game and I am hooked. All you gotta do is treat your outer disciples as if they are sub-human tools to gain extra cultivation for your inner disciples. Yaoguai cultivation about to face tribulation and you're not ready? just use yin god possession on a human and suddenly you don't have to die anymore! 10/10 I'm now addicted to Chinese Cultivaiton

This game, tells you nothing helpful. Doesn't help you in anyway. Will actively try to sabotage you, it will even lie to you. It's full of hidden mechanics. Everything the game does to you, you can do right back to it. True to cultivation, this simulation is accurate in it's ability to be petty and unforgiving. The ultimate kick in the teeth simulator and if you're like me you will love every minute of it. 

Some of the fun things you can do is, weaponize any and everything including your phallus or pile of dog poo to the point where it would slay an ancient dragon god ancestor. Live through the injury having your head blown off, only to possess the body of your best friend's wife to continue living. Suffer every injury known to man.  Learn the truth that no one likes you and they never will like you. Learn that, everyone is awful and so you should just be awful right back. Sit on your butt, take every drug you can find and mediate for years to attain the power to turn your own farts into a nuclear weapon. Okay I lied on the last part...not really, the lie is a lie. 

Have fun now
Eat, sleep, cultivate, repeat.

negative.review: How do you even play this game? The tutorial doesn't teach you anything, and when you are put in a new game after the tutorial, you have no way of building anything except a bonfire? I'm sorry but damn this game is trash.

I desperately wanted to like this game, but I could barely make it past the unintuitive UI. Still I held on to hope until I after 1.5hrs into my first game feeling like STILL simply had no idea what I was doing or how to progress at all.

I feel you would need a better understanding of the cultural aspects (I was keen to learn) and a desire to read multitudes of guides and many a walk-through (NOT KEEN FOR THIS). I am sad to say after 1.5hrs of actual game-play, I have wholly abandoned it with no desire to return. (I forgot to close it on my PC hence the 38.5hrs and no longer able to qualify for a refund).
Game freezes in two of the mini tutorials, no way to fix the freeze except opening the task manager and ending the application altogether. And I'm only through about 20% of the tutorials.

due to adjusting the resolution all the buttons on the right side of my screen have now become unable to be pressed.  i can see them, i can move my mouse to them i can click them. nothing happens. unfortunately to reset this game back to its horrid default resoulution i would need to click that button on the right side of the screen. so games unplayable anymore.

i dont have the time to waste troubleshooting a game in order to make it playable. ill just play something else
Too complex to start playing it with no proper guidelines and the english texts are truncated in several places  and it feels weird.

due to adjusting the resolution all the buttons on the right side of my screen have now become unable to be pressed.  i can see them, i can move my mouse to them i can click them. nothing happens. unfortunately to reset this game back to its horrid default resoulution i would need to click that button on the right side of the screen. so games unplayable anymore.

i dont have the time to waste troubleshooting a game in order to make it playable. ill just play something else
Too complex to start playing it with no proper guidelines and the english texts are truncated in several places  and it feels weird.

How do you even play this game? The tutorial doesn't teach you anything, and when you are put in a new game after the tutorial, you have no way of building anything except a bonfire? I'm sorry but damn this game is trash.
Not fun

I desperately wanted to like this game, but I could barely make it past the unintuitive UI. Still I held on to hope until I after 1.5hrs into my first game feeling like STILL simply had no idea what I was doing or how to progress at all.

I feel you would need a better understanding of the cultural aspects (I was keen to learn) and a desire to read multitudes of guides and many a walk-through (NOT KEEN FOR THIS).
